title: Level 3 Accountancy (60 credits)
subheading: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free
enrolment_fee: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest-free
study_pace: Flexible, you have up to 5 years to complete this course
includes: 1-2-1 tutor support, FREE laptop*, all course materials and more
ucas_points: This course is equivalent to 24 UCAS Tariff Points.
description: This Level 3 university foundation programme is a 60-credit qualification (equivalent to one A level). The objective of the course is to provide learners with a foundation for a career in a range of organisations in relation to financial management and accountancy.

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Accounting course can complete a Level 3 (60 credits) OTHM diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the finance industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you’ll submit 3 online assignments at each level, and assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with an OTHM diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor’s degree at a range of UK universities.

During the Accounting course you’ll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. You can find out more about the support you’ll have available on our Student Resources page. You can also read about the academic credentials we meet and associations we’re part of to make sure you have the best learning experience.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Course Modules
modules1: This course includes the following modules, designed to provide essential accountancy knowledge:

sublists.name: Recording Financial Transactions
sublists.description: Provides a foundational understanding of recording financial transactions, including source documents and classification of income and expenditure.

sublists.name: Management Information
sublists.description: Introduces cost and management accounting concepts and the use of ICT for recording management information, along with its benefits and drawbacks.

sublists.name: Maintaining Financial Records
sublists.description: Covers the importance of keeping financial records, double-entry bookkeeping, and the preparation of a three-column cash book and bank reconciliation statement.

modules2: This foundation diploma in Accountancy has 3 written assignments. The assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Students are provided support on the modules and assignments via the ‘Tutor’ section of the learning platform.
modules3: During this Accountancy course, you’ll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums, and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. You can find out more about the support you’ll have available on our Student Resources page.

section.title: Entry Requirements
section.heading: Am I eligible for this programme?
content: To enrol in our Level 3 Accounting course, you must be at least 16 years old and have a full secondary education.
If you don’t have a full secondary education or the equivalent, you may also be able to enrol based on your work experience.
To find out more, talk to one of our helpful team members at: 0333 772 1158

section.title: Cost and payments
content: Level 3: £2500
Enrol with a £20 deposit and then £103.33 a month for 24 months, interest free.
Students can make payment using one of the following methods:

section.title: Career Progression
section.heading: Progression
content: Studying accounting opens a wide range of career opportunities across various industries. Here are some of the primary career paths you can pursue with an accounting degree:

section.title: University progression
content: Upon completing this course, students can progress to a full BA or BSc degree programme at a variety of UK universities, online or on campus.

title: Level 3 Business Management (120 credits)
subheading: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free
study_pace: Flexible, you have up to 5 years to complete this course
includes: 1-2-1 tutor support, FREE laptop*, all course materials and more
ofqual_link: Level 3 Integrated Diploma in Business Management – 603/4730/2
ucas_points: This course is equivalent to 96 UCAS Tariff Points.
description: The Level 3 Business Management course is a 120-credit qualification (equivalent to two A levels) that helps students learn key concepts and a range of management procedures required to work within a business.
how_it_works: Students on our Business Management course can complete a Level 3 (120 credits) Qualifi diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the finance industry. The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks. To complete the course you’ll submit 12 online assignments at each level, and assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with a Qualifi diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor’s degree at a range of UK universities.

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Business Management course can complete a Level 3 (120 credits) Qualifi diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the finance industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you’ll submit 12 online assignments at each level, and assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with an Qualifi diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor’s degree at a range of UK universities.

During the Business Management course you’ll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. You can find out more about the support you’ll have available on our Student Resources page. You can also read about the academic credentials we meet and associations we’re part of to make sure you have the best learning experience.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Course Modules
modules1: This course includes the following modules, designed to provide essential business knowledge:

sublists.name: Effective Business Communication
sublists.description: Focuses on developing communication skills vital for business success.

sublists.name: Managing Business Operations
sublists.description: Covers the essentials of running day-to-day business activities efficiently.

sublists.name: Managing People in Organisations
sublists.description: Explores techniques for effective people management within an organisation.

sublists.name: Maximising Resources
sublists.description: Looks at how to optimise the use of resources to improve business performance.

sublists.name: The Business Environment
sublists.description: Introduces the external and internal factors influencing businesses.

sublists.name: Working in Teams
sublists.description: Enhances understanding of team dynamics and collaborative work in business.

modules2: The following written assignments are part of the course:

sublists: An Introduction to the Business Environment
Understanding Health and Safety in the Business Workplace

section.title: Career Progression
section.heading: Progression
content: Studying Business Management can lead to entry-level roles such as business analyst, management trainee, or marketing coordinator.
With experience, individuals can advance to mid-level positions like project manager, marketing manager, or operations manager.
Further progression can lead to senior roles such as director, vice president, or CEO.

section.title: University progression
content: Upon completing this course, students can progress to a full BA or BSc degree programme at a variety of UK universities, online or on campus.

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Business Management course can complete a Level 3 (60 credits) Qualifi diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the finance industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Course Modules
modules1: This course includes the following modules, designed to provide essential business knowledge:

sublists.name: An Introduction to Marketing
sublists.description: Covers key concepts of the marketing mix, planning, and research. Explains the strategic role of marketing and how it contributes to business success.

sublists.name: An Introduction to the Business Environment
sublists.description: Explores different business types and ownership, roles of owners and stakeholders, organisational structure, and the influence of economic, political, legal, and social environments.

sublists.name: Business Communication
sublists.description: Focuses on internal and external communication methods and types of business information. Students develop and evaluate communication strategies.

sublists.name: Business Resources
sublists.description: Examines the use and management of human, physical, technological, and financial resources. Emphasises employability and resource effectiveness.

sublists.name: Human Resource Management
sublists.description: Introduces key HR functions and planning. Covers employee motivation, commitment, and strategic HR practices.

sublists.name: Recruitment and Selection in Business
sublists.description: Details the recruitment and selection process, legal considerations, document preparation, and HR's role in achieving organisational objectives.

modules2: The following written assignments are part of the course:

sublists: An Introduction to the Business Environment

section.heading: Progression

title: Level 3 Engineering
subheading: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free
study_pace: Flexible, up to 5 years to complete

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Engineering course can complete a Level 3 (60 credits) OTHM diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the Engineering industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you’ll submit 6 online assignments at each level, and assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with an OTHM diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor’s degree at a range of UK universities.

During this Engineering course you’ll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Course Modules
modules1: This course includes the following modules, designed to provide students with essential knowledge and skills for engineering:

sublists.name: Engineering Principles
sublists.description: Understand applications of SI units and measurement, perform engineering calculations, and interpret engineering information.

sublists.name: Design Technology
sublists.description: Covers knowledge of engineering products and design, systems approach to electrical design, and 2D CAD drawing production.

sublists.name: Electricity
sublists.description: Focuses on basic electrical components, AC/DC circuit theory, power supplies, and power system protection.

sublists.name: Mechanics
sublists.description: Explores motion, energy changes, energy transfer, forces, and elasticity in mathematical terms.

sublists.name: Introducing Statistics
sublists.description: Covers statistical analysis, data types and their representation, and interpretation of statistical diagrams and measures.

sublists.name: Mathematics
sublists.description: Focuses on algebra, geometry, graphs, exponentials, logarithms, trigonometry, and calculus relevant to engineering problems.

title: Level 3 Introduction to Management Diploma
subheading: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free
study_pace: Flexible, up to 5 years to complete

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Introduction to Management course can complete a Level 3 (60 credits) OTHM diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the Management industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it’s completely flexible. Each module consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you’ll submit 6 online assignments at each level, and assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you’ve passed your course, you’ll be awarded with an OTHM diploma and you’ll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor’s degree at a range of UK universities.

During this Introduction to ManagementCourse  you’ll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Course Modules
modules1: This course includes the following modules, designed to provide students with essential knowledge and skills for business management:

sublists.name: An Introduction to Finance
sublists.description: Introduces learners to practical accounting and financial reporting techniques used by managers in business organisations.

sublists.name: An Introduction to Leadership Skills
sublists.description: Provides an introduction to leadership skills, their identification and development, and the importance of motivating others.

sublists.name: Managing Business Operations
sublists.description: Covers key aspects of how businesses operate internally and within the wider environment, emphasizing operational control and best practices.

sublists.name: Organisational Culture
sublists.description: Explores the impact of an organisation’s culture on its activities and management, including the importance of ethical business practices.

sublists.name: Working in Teams
sublists.description: Examines the role and dynamics of teams in organisations, the value of teamwork, and how teams are formed and function.

sublists.name: Workplace Welfare
sublists.description: Focuses on the importance of valuing employees and the benefits of ensuring welfare within the organisation.

modules2: The following written assignments are part of the course:
